headline: The J.M. Smucker Co. Announces Commitment to Remove FD&C Colors from Consumer Food Products
summary: The J.M. Smucker Co. (NYSE: SJM) today announced its commitment to remove FD&C colors from all consumer food products by the end of calendar year 2027. While the majority of the Company's consumer foods are already free of FD&C colors, this removal will impact its sugar-free fruit spreads and ice cream toppings as well as certain products from its Hostess® brand portfolio. In addition, a majority of the Company's products currently available to K-12 schools do not contain any FD&C colors and the

headline: JM Smucker plans tariff-driven price hike for coffee
summary: The food and beverage company faces import fee exposure in direct materials, product exports and capital items used in manufacturing.

headline: McCormick Stock Is Climbing. Spice Maker’s Earnings Beat Expectations.
summary: Shares of  McCormick & Company  were rising Thursday after the spices and seasonings maker posted quarterly earnings that were good enough for Wall Street’s taste.  The company reported adjusted earnings of 69 cents a share on net sales of $1.66 billion for its fiscal second quarter, narrowly above analysts’ consensus forecasts of 65 cents a share and sales of $1.658 billion.  McCormick  also reiterated its fiscal-year forecasts, which called for modest growth across key financial metrics.
